multiple-choice.question: Let $C_1$ be a fair coin that has $H$ on one side and $T$ on the other side. Let $C_2$ be a coin that has $H$ on both sides. We choose one of $C_1$ and $C_2$ uniformly at random and flip it. Define the events [defs] A = "we choose $C_2$", B = "the flip resulted in $H$". [/defs] What is the conditional probability $\Pr(A|B)$?
